definition: surname Mo/abbr. for 墨西哥[Mo4 xi1 ge1], Mexico
ink stick/China ink/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/corporal punishment consisting of tattooing characters on the victim's forehead

sentences.english: The page has been blurred with ink in four places.
sentences.chinese: 这页有四个地方有墨渍。

sentences.english: The film is a Rorschach test of where people stand.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片是一个墨渍心理测验，可以看出人们的立场。

sentences.english: The book was worn out and had ink stains on its cover.
sentences.chinese: 这本书破旧了，封面上有墨渍。

sentences.english: The book is worn out and has ink stain on its cover.
sentences.chinese: 这本书破旧了，封面上有墨渍。

sentences.english: He's got an ink stain on his shirt.
She finally scrubbed the ink stains away from her hands.
sentences.chinese: 她终于把手上的墨渍擦洗掉了。

definition: water spot/water stain/wet spot/damp patch/water damage
to moisten/to dampen/to be steeped in/to be imbued with
annotations made in a book/fig. remarks and comments/to have an opinion on everything
